arguments.comment:
When using fixed point AttribType (f.e. Uint8)
value will be normalized for vertex shader usage. When normalized
is set to true, AttribType::Uint8 value in range 0-255 will be
in range 0.0-1.0 in vertex shader.

Packaging rule for vertexPack, vertexUnpack, and
vertexConvert for AttribType::Uint8 and AttribType::Int16.
Unpacking code must be implemented inside vertex shader.

Destination index buffer. If this argument is NULL

insufficient index buffer will be truncated.
Set to `true` if input indices are 32-bit.

arguments.comment:
Destination index buffer in bytes. It must be
large enough to contain output indices. If destination size is
insufficient index buffer will be truncated.

Pointer to first vertex represented as
float x, y, z. Must contain at least number of vertices
referencende by index buffer.
Set to `true` if input indices are 32-bit.

functions.comment: Initialize the bgfx library.
functions.name: init

functions.comment: Shutdown bgfx library.
functions.name: shutdown

arguments.comment:
See: `BGFX_RESET_*` for more info.
  - `BGFX_RESET_NONE` - No reset flags.
  - `BGFX_RESET_FULLSCREEN` - Not supported yet.
  - `BGFX_RESET_MSAA_X[2/4/8/16]` - Enable 2, 4, 8 or 16 x MSAA.
  - `BGFX_RESET_VSYNC` - Enable V-Sync.
  - `BGFX_RESET_MAXANISOTROPY` - Turn on/off max anisotropy.
  - `BGFX_RESET_CAPTURE` - Begin screen capture.
  - `BGFX_RESET_FLUSH_AFTER_RENDER` - Flush rendering after submitting to GPU.
  - `BGFX_RESET_FLIP_AFTER_RENDER` - This flag  specifies where flip
    occurs. Default behaviour is that flip occurs before rendering new
    frame. This flag only has effect when `BGFX_CONFIG_MULTITHREADED=0`.
  - `BGFX_RESET_SRGB_BACKBUFFER` - Enable sRGB back-buffer.

functions.name: reset

functions.comment:
Advance to next frame. When using multithreaded renderer, this call
just swaps internal buffers, kicks render thread, and returns. In
singlethreaded renderer this call does frame rendering.
functions.name: frame
getRendererType
getCaps

functions.comment:
Returns performance counters.
@attention Pointer returned is valid until `bgfx::frame` is called.
functions.name: getStats

functions.comment: Allocate buffer to pass to bgfx calls. Data will be freed inside bgfx.
functions.name: alloc

arguments.comment: Pointer to data to be copied.
Size of data to be copied.

functions.comment: Allocate buffer and copy data into it. Data will be freed inside bgfx.
functions.name: copy

functions.comment:
Make reference to data to pass to bgfx. Unlike `bgfx::alloc`, this call
doesn't allocate memory for data. It just copies the _data pointer. You
can pass `ReleaseFn` function pointer to release this memory after it's
consumed, otherwise you must make sure _data is available for at least 2
`bgfx::frame` calls. `ReleaseFn` function must be able to be called
from any thread.
@attention Data passed must be available for at least 2 `bgfx::frame` calls.
functions.name: makeRef

arguments.comment: Callback function to release memory after use.
User data to be passed to callback function.

functions.comment:
Make reference to data to pass to bgfx. Unlike `bgfx::alloc`, this call
doesn't allocate memory for data. It just copies the _data pointer. You
can pass `ReleaseFn` function pointer to release this memory after it's
consumed, otherwise you must make sure _data is available for at least 2
`bgfx::frame` calls. `ReleaseFn` function must be able to be called
from any thread.
@attention Data passed must be available for at least 2 `bgfx::frame` calls.
functions.name: makeRefRelease

arguments.comment:
Available flags:
  - `BGFX_DEBUG_IFH` - Infinitely fast hardware. When this flag is set
    all rendering calls will be skipped. This is useful when profiling
    to quickly assess potential bottlenecks between CPU and GPU.
  - `BGFX_DEBUG_PROFILER` - Enable profiler.
  - `BGFX_DEBUG_STATS` - Display internal statistics.
  - `BGFX_DEBUG_TEXT` - Display debug text.
  - `BGFX_DEBUG_WIREFRAME` - Wireframe rendering. All rendering
    primitives will be rendered as lines.

4-bits represent foreground color from standard VGA text palette (ANSI escape codes).

arguments.comment:
Buffer creation flags.
  - `BGFX_BUFFER_NONE` - No flags.
  - `BGFX_BUFFER_COMPUTE_READ` - Buffer will be read from by compute shader.
  - `BGFX_BUFFER_COMPUTE_WRITE` - Buffer will be written into by compute shader. When buffer
      is created with `BGFX_BUFFER_COMPUTE_WRITE` flag it cannot be updated from CPU.
  - `BGFX_BUFFER_COMPUTE_READ_WRITE` - Buffer will be used for read/write by compute shader.
  - `BGFX_BUFFER_ALLOW_RESIZE` - Buffer will resize on buffer update if a different amount of
      data is passed. If this flag is not specified, and more data is passed on update, the buffer
      will be trimmed to fit the existing buffer size. This flag has effect only on dynamic
      buffers.
  - `BGFX_BUFFER_INDEX32` - Buffer is using 32-bit indices. This flag has effect only on
      index buffers.

Texture creation (see `BGFX_TEXTURE_*`.), and sampler (see `BGFX_SAMPLER_*`)
flags. Default texture sampling mode is linear, and wrap mode is repeat.
- `BGFX_SAMPLER_[U/V/W]_[MIRROR/CLAMP]` - Mirror or clamp to edge wrap
  mode.
- `BGFX_SAMPLER_[MIN/MAG/MIP]_[POINT/ANISOTROPIC]` - Point or anisotropic
  sampling.
Skip top level mips when parsing texture.
When non-`NULL` is specified it returns parsed texture information.

functions.comment: Create texture from memory buffer.

arguments.comment: Indicates that texture contains full mip-map chain.

Number of layers in texture array. Must be 1 if caps
`BGFX_CAPS_TEXTURE_2D_ARRAY` flag is not set.

Texture creation (see `BGFX_TEXTURE_*`.), and sampler (see `BGFX_SAMPLER_*`)
flags. Default texture sampling mode is linear, and wrap mode is repeat.
- `BGFX_SAMPLER_[U/V/W]_[MIRROR/CLAMP]` - Mirror or clamp to edge wrap
  mode.
- `BGFX_SAMPLER_[MIN/MAG/MIP]_[POINT/ANISOTROPIC]` - Point or anisotropic
  sampling.

Texture data. If `_mem` is non-NULL, created texture will be immutable. If
`_mem` is NULL content of the texture is uninitialized. When `_numLayers` is more than
1, expected memory layout is texture and all mips together for each array element.

functions.comment:
Create shader uniform parameter.
@remarks
  1. Uniform names are unique. It's valid to call `bgfx::createUniform`
     multiple times with the same uniform name. The library will always
     return the same handle, but the handle reference count will be
     incremented. This means that the same number of `bgfx::destroyUniform`
     must be called to properly destroy the uniform.
  2. Predefined uniforms (declared in `bgfx_shader.sh`):
     - `u_viewRect vec4(x, y, width, height)` - view rectangle for current
       view, in pixels.
     - `u_viewTexel vec4(1.0/width, 1.0/height, undef, undef)` - inverse
       width and height
     - `u_view mat4` - view matrix
     - `u_invView mat4` - inverted view matrix
     - `u_proj mat4` - projection matrix
     - `u_invProj mat4` - inverted projection matrix
     - `u_viewProj mat4` - concatenated view projection matrix
     - `u_invViewProj mat4` - concatenated inverted view projection matrix
     - `u_model mat4[BGFX_CONFIG_MAX_BONES]` - array of model matrices.
     - `u_modelView mat4` - concatenated model view matrix, only first
       model matrix from array is used.
     - `u_modelViewProj mat4` - concatenated model view projection matrix.
     - `u_alphaRef float` - alpha reference value for alpha test.
functions.name: createUniform

functions.comment: Retrieve uniform info.
functions.name: getUniformInfo

functions.comment: Destroy shader uniform parameter.
functions.name: destroyUniform

frame buffer handle will draw primitives from this view into

arguments.comment:
Marker name length (if length is INT32_MAX, it's expected
that _name is zero terminated string.

functions.comment:
Sets a debug marker. This allows you to group graphics calls together for easy browsing in
graphics debugging tools.
functions.name: encoderSetMarker

arguments.comment:
State flags. Default state for primitive type is
  triangles. See: `BGFX_STATE_DEFAULT`.
  - `BGFX_STATE_DEPTH_TEST_*` - Depth test function.
  - `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_*` - See remark 1 about BGFX_STATE_BLEND_FUNC.
  - `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_EQUATION_*` - See remark 2.
  - `BGFX_STATE_CULL_*` - Backface culling mode.
  - `BGFX_STATE_WRITE_*` - Enable R, G, B, A or Z write.
  - `BGFX_STATE_MSAA` - Enable hardware multisample antialiasing.
  - `BGFX_STATE_PT_[TRISTRIP/LINES/POINTS]` - Primitive type.

Sets blend factor used by `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_FACTOR` and
  `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_INV_FACTOR` blend modes.

functions.comment:
Set render states for draw primitive.
@remarks
  1. To set up more complex states use:
     `BGFX_STATE_ALPHA_REF(_ref)`,
     `BGFX_STATE_POINT_SIZE(_size)`,
     `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_FUNC(_src, _dst)`,
     `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_FUNC_SEPARATE(_srcRGB, _dstRGB, _srcA, _dstA)`,
     `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_EQUATION(_equation)`,
     `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_EQUATION_SEPARATE(_equationRGB, _equationA)`
  2. `BGFX_STATE_BLEND_EQUATION_ADD` is set when no other blend
     equation is specified.
functions.name: encoderSetState

arguments.comment: Render if occlusion query is visible.

    sampling.

functions.comment:
Submit an empty primitive for rendering. Uniforms and draw state
will be applied but no geometry will be submitted. Useful in cases
when no other draw/compute primitive is submitted to view, but it's
desired to execute clear view.
@remark
  These empty draw calls will sort before ordinary draw calls.

arguments.comment:
If texture is 2D this argument should be 0. If destination texture is cube
this argument represents destination texture cube face. For 3D texture this argument
represents destination texture Z position.

If texture is 2D this argument should be 0. If source texture is cube
this argument represents source texture cube face. For 3D texture this argument
represents source texture Z position.

If texture is 3D this argument represents depth of region, otherwise it's
unused.

functions.name: encoderBlit

arguments.comment:
Frame buffer handle. If handle is `BGFX_INVALID_HANDLE` request will be
made for main window back buffer.

functions.name: requestScreenShot

functions.comment:
Render frame.
@attention `bgfx::renderFrame` is blocking call. It waits for
  `bgfx::frame` to be called from API thread to process frame.
  If timeout value is passed call will timeout and return even
  if `bgfx::frame` is not called.
@warning This call should be only used on platforms that don't
  allow creating separate rendering thread. If it is called before
  to bgfx::init, render thread won't be created by bgfx::init call.
functions.name: renderFrame

functions.comment:
Set platform data.
@warning Must be called before `bgfx::init`.

getInternalData
overrideInternalTexturePtr

arguments.comment:
Texture creation (see `BGFX_TEXTURE_*`.), and sampler (see `BGFX_SAMPLER_*`)
flags. Default texture sampling mode is linear, and wrap mode is repeat.
- `BGFX_SAMPLER_[U/V/W]_[MIRROR/CLAMP]` - Mirror or clamp to edge wrap
  mode.
- `BGFX_SAMPLER_[MIN/MAG/MIP]_[POINT/ANISOTROPIC]` - Point or anisotropic
  sampling.

arguments.comment:
If texture is 2D this argument should be 0. If destination texture is cube
this argument represents destination texture cube face. For 3D texture this argument
represents destination texture Z position.

If texture is 2D this argument should be 0. If source texture is cube
this argument represents source texture cube face. For 3D texture this argument
represents source texture Z position.

unused.

values.comment: Enable depth test, less or equal.
values.name: DepthTestLequal

values.comment: Enable depth test, greater or equal.
values.name: DepthTestGequal

values.comment:
Default state is write to RGB, alpha, and depth with depth test less enabled, with clockwise
culling and MSAA (when writing into MSAA frame buffer, otherwise this flag is ignored).
values.name: Default

values.comment: Enable stencil test, less or equal.
values.name: TestLequal

values.comment: Enable stencil test, greater or equal.
values.name: TestGequal

values.comment: Discard texture sampler and buffer bindings.
values.name: Bindings

values.comment:
Enable infinitely fast hardware test. No draw calls will be submitted to driver.
It's useful when profiling to quickly assess bottleneck between CPU and GPU.
values.name: Ifh

values.comment: Enable profiler. This causes per-view statistics to be collected, available through `bgfx::Stats::ViewStats`. This is unrelated to the profiler functions in `bgfx::CallbackI`.
values.name: Profiler

values.comment: Buffer will be read by shader.
values.name: ComputeRead

values.comment: Buffer will be used for writing.
values.name: ComputeWrite

values.comment: Buffer will be used for storing draw indirect commands.
values.name: DrawIndirect

values.comment: Allow dynamic index/vertex buffer resize during update.
values.name: AllowResize

values.comment: Texture will be used for MSAA sampling.
values.name: MsaaSample

values.comment: Texture will be used for compute write.
values.name: ComputeWrite

values.comment: Texture will be used as blit destination.
values.name: BlitDst

values.comment: Texture will be used for read back from GPU.
values.name: ReadBack

values.comment: Render target will be used for writing
values.name: RtWriteOnly

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: less.
values.name: CompareLess

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: less or equal.
values.name: CompareLequal

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: equal.
values.name: CompareEqual

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: greater or equal.
values.name: CompareGequal

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: greater.
values.name: CompareGreater

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: not equal.
values.name: CompareNotequal

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: never.
values.name: CompareNever

values.comment: Compare when sampling depth texture: always.
values.name: CompareAlways

values.comment: Flush rendering after submitting to GPU.
values.name: FlushAfterRender

values.comment:
This flag specifies where flip occurs. Default behaviour is that flip occurs
before rendering new frame. This flag only has effect when `BGFX_CONFIG_MULTITHREADED=0`.
values.name: FlipAfterRender

values.comment: Fragment depth is available in fragment shader.
values.name: FragmentDepth

values.comment: Fragment ordering is available in fragment shader.
values.name: FragmentOrdering

values.comment: Texture compare less equal mode is supported.
values.name: TextureCompareLequal

values.comment: CPU direct access to GPU texture memory.
values.name: TextureDirectAccess

values.comment: Rendering with VertexID only is supported.
values.name: VertexId

values.comment: PrimitiveID is available in fragment shader.
values.name: PrimitiveId

values.comment: Viewport layer is available in vertex shader.
values.name: ViewportLayerArray

values.comment: Draw indirect with indirect count is supported.
values.name: DrawIndirectCount

values.comment: All texture compare modes are supported.
values.name: TextureCompareAll

values.comment: Texture as sRGB format is supported.
values.name: Texture2dSrgb

values.comment: Texture as sRGB format is supported.
values.name: Texture3dSrgb

values.comment: Texture as sRGB format is supported.
values.name: TextureCubeSrgb

values.comment: Texture format can be used from vertex shader.
values.name: TextureVertex

values.comment: Texture format can be used as image and read from.
values.name: TextureImageRead

values.comment: Texture format can be used as image and written to.
values.name: TextureImageWrite

values.comment: Texture format can be used as frame buffer.
values.name: TextureFramebuffer

values.comment: Texture format can be used as MSAA frame buffer.
values.name: TextureFramebufferMsaa

values.comment: Texture can be sampled as MSAA.
values.name: TextureMsaa

values.comment: BC7 RGB 4-7 bits per color channel, 0-8 bits alpha
values.name: BC7

values.comment: Query result is not available yet.
values.name: NoResult

values.comment: Flip winding order of triangle list.
values.name: TriListFlipWinding

values.comment: Flip winding order of triangle strip.
values.name: TriStripFlipWinding

values.comment: Convert triangle list to line list.
values.name: TriListToLineList

values.comment: Convert triangle strip to triangle list.
values.name: TriStripToTriList

values.comment: Convert line strip to line list.
values.name: LineStripToLineList

values.comment: Sort in the same order in which submit calls were called.
values.name: Sequential

values.comment: Sort draw call depth in ascending order.
values.name: DepthAscending

values.comment: Sort draw call depth in descending order.
values.name: DepthDescending

values.comment: Platform default handle type (X11 on Linux).

values.comment: Renderer context is not created yet.
